text:
They turned heads as they stormed the red carpet for the BRITs ceremony on Wednesday night.
And Ellie Goulding and Katy Perry ensured they would also have all eyes on them at the Universal Music after party as they changed into equally as glamorous new ensembles.
Flaunting her incredible figure in a little black dress, Ellie, 30, looked phenomenal on the evening as she made her way into the bash.
Twice as nice: Ellie Goulding and Katy Perry changed into second sexy ensembles for the Universal Music after party on Wednesday night after the BRIT Awards at the O2 Arena, ensuring all eyes would firmly be on them
Flashing her tanned and toned pins, Ellie donned a pair of black court heels, whilst a pair of dazzling diamond earrings and a choker injected some glitz into the ensemble.
Ellie finished off the look by styling her golden locks in loose waves which framed her pretty features.
Katy also looked incredible as she slipped into a sheer jumpsuit adorned with floral detailing that complementedh her freshly dyed blonde bob.
The garment cinched in at her slender waist whilst sheer detailing on the sleeves and legs offered a look at her incredible figure whilst remaining demure.
She finished off the look by styling her golden tresses in loose tousled waves, whilst a pair of scarlet barely-there heels gave her frame an extra boost.
Good as Goulding! Ellie changed into a low-cut black midi dress. Flaunting her incredible figure, the singer looked phenomenal on the evening as she made her way into the bash
Two's company: Ellie was joined at the event by her sister Jordan who she walked the red carpet at the BRITs. Once inside she also posed for snaps with The Saturdays star Mollie King
Blonde bombshell: Ellie looked sensational as she sashayed into the venue in her tight little black dress
Ellie was pictured out with her ex boyfriend Dougie Poynter just two nights before, but she decided to bring her sister as her plus one to the BRITs .
The singer, 30, and her rarely-seen sibling walked the red carpet together on Wednesday night at London 's iconic o2 arena.
While both were clad in long black gowns for the occasion, the pair looked worlds apart from one another, with Jordan, 28, also sporting an inking on one arm.
Legs eleven! Sheer trousers offered a look at her tanned and toned pins as she strode inside
Perry nice! The garment cinched in at her slender waist whilst sheer detailing on the sleeves and legs offered a look at her incredible figure whilst remaining demure
Gal pals: Ellie cosied up to Katy inside the bash as they posed together on the sofa for snaps

Ellie, who is nominated in the British Female Solo Artist category, was dressed to impress in the figure-hugging attire, featuring a daring cut-out at the bust and silver chain detailing.
The edgy black dress boasted a daring thigh-high split running up the centre of the dress, offering a glimpse of her long legs as she sashayed along the red carpet.
The Burn singer gave her glamorous awards ceremony attire a twist thanks to statement silver accessories to match the chain detailing on the dress, including Malone Souliers heels.
All about tonight! Pixie Lott also looked incredible in a little black dress which featured tassel detailing
Posing up a storm! Tallia Storm donned a pink ruffled blouse beneath a green smock dress that showed off her lean legs. She added some height to her frame in patent red heels
Metal chains snaked down the back of the halterneck number and around her neck, displaying a glimpse of her tattoos.
Jordan's gown had an extreme plunging neckline, which she wore with a 90s style choker.
The 37th BRIT Awards ceremony features a star-studded line-up with Katy Perry, Ed Sheeran, Robbie Williams, Little Mix, Bruno Mars, The 1975, Emeli Sandé and Skepta all taking the stage.
Furry nice! Mollie King layered up over her tiny silver dress by donning a shaggy aquamarine coat with navy splotches
Chic and cheerful: Lisa Snowdon dressed down in a boxy floral top that she teamed with cropped black leather trousers
Emma Willis and Dermot O'Leary presented the show after being drafted in when Michael Buble was forced to pull out due to his son's battle with cancer.
'The BRITs is an iconic show that I've watched and attended many times,' said Dermot about his hosting duties. 'It's a holy grail for a broadcaster, and I'm really looking forward to working with Emma, who I'm a big fan of, and celebrating a brilliant year of British music.'
'To present the BRITs is an honour but to be doing it alongside one of my absolute favourites, Mr Dermot O'Leary is just bonkers. Bring on the BRITs 2017,' added Emma.
Winners lap: After scooping Best British female it was no wonder Emeli Sande was in great spirits as she attended the after party. Having changed into a navy floral dress, the songstress looked incredible as she cosied up to Naughty Boy on the night
Double trouble! Sophie Dahl looked loved-up with husband Jamie Cullum as they posed for snaps together at the awards bash before ripping off her coat and partying with Sara Cox
Cute couple: The duo made for a handsome pair as they snuggled up together on the side of a sofa
David Bowie was the big winner at the 2017 BRIT Awards.
The late star - who passed away in 2016 after a secret battle with cancer - beat The 1975, Michael Kiwanuka, Kano and Skepta to win the MasterCard British Album of the Year award for his album 'Blackstar' at the ceremony at London's O2 on Wednesday (22.02.17).
Noel Gallagher announced the winner and presented the award to David's son, director Duncan Jones.
Duncan said: "I lost my dad last year but I also became a dad. And I was trying to work out what I would want my son to know about his grandad. He's always been there supporting people who think they are a little bit strange or different so this award is for all the kooks and all those who make the kooks. Thanks BRITs."
Brit of all right! Katy Perry, Pixie Lott, Emeli Sande and Mollie King all posed for snaps next to the BRIT statue poster
Loving life: Naughty Boy, Nick Grimshaw and Sara Cox and Nicole Appleton also couldn't resist posing for snaps
Earlier, David also won the British Male Solo Artist award, beating Craig David, Skepta, Kano and Michael Kiwanuka and Michael C. Hall accepted the gong on his behalf from presenter Zane Lowe.
Speaking about the icon, Michael - who starred in 'Bowie's 'Lazarus' musical - quipped that he wouldn't have attended the BRITs even if he was alive.
He said: "If David Bowie could be here tonight, he probably wouldn't be here tonight. But I am here tonight on behalf of his family to accept this testament to a man beholden to nothing but his own imagination."
Michael went on to praise David, saying: "His vitality soothes us and I'm honoured to stand before you and celebrate his work. David's kindness, generosity and enthusiasm will inspire me to be a better man."
Schermazing! Nicole Scherzinger dazzled in a silver gown that showed off every inch of her hourglass curves
Chest a glimpse! Nicole went braless beneath the garment, flashing plenty of side and under boob
One Direction won the British Video award, and Liam Payne accepted on behalf of the group, who are currently on hiatus.
He said: 'This is amazing, thank you so much. We cannot believe we are still winning things like this.
'We are taking some time out to do our solo stuff but One Direction is who we are and who we always will be. This one is for you.'
Spinning tunes: Nick Grimshaw was the resident DJ on the night and seemed in great spirits as he jumped on the decks
Loving life: The group were chatting away and dancing as the music played in the background
Hope to it: Ellie and Katy threw some shapes on the dancefloor as Nick provided the musical entertainment
Loving life: The group were all in great spirits as the party got into full swing on the evening
Suited and booted! Jedward turned heads in their snazzy silver suits and red velvet boots
Peek-a-boob! Ashley James flashed her ample assets in a red latex gown that unfortunately went see-through beneath the bright lights as she cosied up to her friend on their way into the venue
Meanwhile, Little Mix dedicated their British Single of the Year award at the BRITs to their exes.
The girlband - comprised of Perrie Edwards, Jesy Nelson, Leigh-Anne Pinnock and Jade Thirlwall - won for 'Shout Out To My Ex' and thanked their own past loves in their acceptance speech.
Jade said: 'Thank you so much. We honestly didn't think we were gonna get it, we were just sat there chinwagging. We'd like to thank our label Sony, Syco, Simon (Cowell), our amazing A&R, our management, and us girls, because if it wasn't for our friendship, we wouldn't still be going.
'And lastly cheers to our exes for helping us to do an amazing song, this one's for you lads.'
No doubt Perrie was especially pleased as the group - who also opened the show - beat her former fiance Zayn Malik's 'Pillowtalk' to take home the gong.
No Dougie tonight? Ellie brought her rarely-seen sister Jordan as her plus one to the BRITs held at London's o2 arena on Wednesday night... two days after reuniting with her ex
Silk sensation: Ellie's bodyform number clung to her athletic figure in all the right places
Rock 'n' roll edge: The statement dress was finished with silver chain detailing at the bust and hanging down her back from the halterneck neckline
Strong look: The Burn singer gave her glamorous awards ceremony attire a twist thanks to statement silver accessories to match the chain detailing on the dress
Legs for days: The edgy black dress boasted a daring thigh-high split running up the centre of the dress, offering a glimpse of her long legs
Natural beauty: The Anything Could Happen singer opted for barely-there make-up including soft pink lipstick
And Rag'N'Bone Man, who was awarded the Critics’ Choice Brit Award in December, picked up the British Breakthrough Act and declared himself speechless when his name was called out by presenters Nick Grimshaw and Rita Ora.
After winning the gong over his competitors Anne-Marie, Skepta, Blossoms and Stormzy, he said: "I just want to say thank you to all my fans. You've been amazing and I appreciate your votes so much.
'I don't know what else to say, I'm speechless but thank you so much, honestly.'
iReuniting: Ellie sent tongues wagging as she joined her former flame Dougie Poynter at Burberry's Love Magazine party, shortly after the Vivienne Westwood bash at LFW on Monday
Emeli Sande won British Female Solo Artist, Adele was presented with the Global Success Award, British Group went to The 1975 and International Group and Male and Female Solo Artist went to A Tribe Called Quest, Drake and Beyonce.
Little Mix opened the show with a performance of 'Shout Out To My Ex', while Katy Perry, Bruno Mars, The 1975 all performed.
Ed Sheeran and Stormzy wowed the crowd with a collaboration on 'Shape of You', while Coldplay also teamed up with The Chainsmokers before BRITs Icon Robbie Williams closed the show.
